display_asset.caption: Dr. Larycia Hawkins spoke at a news conference last month about termination proceedings against her by Wheaton College, an evangelical Christian institution in Illinois.

summaries.body: Wheaton College, an evangelical institution, and an associate professor who donned a hijab in "religious solidarity with Muslims” are to part ways, they announced.

display_asset.caption: Mark Zuckerberg, chief executive of Facebook, speaking in New Delhi in 2014. He personally lobbied for the company’s Free Basics program.

summaries.body: Facebook experienced a setback in India, where regulators banned free mobile data programs, such as its Free Basics program, that favor some Internet services over others.
Twenty-three migrants have drowned after a boat sank off the coast of Turkey, the Turkish Coast Guard said, and a search is underway for the remaining passengers.
In an interview, the late photographer Dennis Stock recalls how he shot his ​classic photo essay of James Dean​, who was born 85 years ago today.
Seltzer contains an acid that erodes your tooth enamel.

asset.embed_html: <iframe class="embedly-embed" src="//cdn.embedly.com/widgets/media.html?src=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.youtube.com%2Fembed%2FMh5LY4Mz15o%3Ffeature%3Doembed&url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.youtube.com%2Fwatch%3Fv%3DMh5LY4Mz15o&image=https%3A%2F%2Fi.ytimg.com%2Fvi%2FMh5LY4Mz15o%2Fhqdefault.jpg&key=170aca4a25074a88942b11f27e7ca43f&type=text%2Fhtml&schema=youtube" width="854" height="480" scrolling="no" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>

summaries.body: This video history of Japan takes viewers from humans’ first presence on the archipelago all the way to 1991.
The chief executive of Credit Suisse has asked the company’s board to ​reduce his bonus​ after the bank reported a multibillion-dollar quarterly loss.

display_asset.caption: Misael Lopez and his pit bull Cookie visited a new pet food pantry in the Bronx last month. The pantry gave away 2,000 pounds of pet food in one month.

summaries.body: Pet food pantries have sprung up across the country, including in New York City, to help people who view their pets as family, and spend their last dollars on a can of Purina.
A newly obtained report shows that a task force commissioned by the oil industry in 1982 acknowledged the fateful impact that humans could have on the climate.
CBS used a Super Bowl commercial to announce that the current season of "The Good Wife" would be its last. It was "the biggest 'Good Wife' surprise yet," the ad said.

display_asset.caption: Footage of the eruption of the volcano on Mount Sakurajima, on the southern Japanese island Kyushu. It is 30 miles from a nuclear plant.

sectionFrontImages.caption: Sakurajima volcano erupted in southern Japan on Friday.

display_asset.title: Sakurajima Volcano Erupts

summaries.body: Here is dramatic footage of an ​erupting volcano on Mount Sakurajima, located 30 miles from a nuclear plant in southern Japan.

display_asset.caption: Pat Haden took over as head of U.S.C.’s athletic department in 2010.

summaries.body: Pat Haden, who won two national titles as a quarterback at U.S.C. and then became its athletic director after it was hit with N.C.A.A. sanctions, will step down in June.

display_asset.caption: An olm, a foot-long cave-dwelling amphibian, in the Postojna Cave in Slovenia.

summaries.body: Biologists in Slovenia are awaiting a rare brood of olms, cave-dwelling salamanders once thought of as tiny dragons that can live to 100 and go 10 years without food.

display_asset.caption: From left, Rachel McAdams, Mark Ruffalo, Brian d’Arcy James, Michael Keaton and John Slattery in a scene from “Spotlight.”
display_asset.credit: Kerry Hayes/Open Road Films, via Associated Press

summaries.body: A Vatican commission investigating sexual abuse by priests got a private screening of the movie "Spotlight," which depicts The Boston Globe's reporting of those crimes.

Employees of a San Diego restaurant arrived at work Thursday to find a sea lion pup curled up in a booth. Cute, yes, but also an example of a species being found in unexpected places because of a changing environment.

display_asset.caption: Julian Assange gave a speech from a balcony at the Ecuadorian Embassy in London in 2012.

summaries.body: The New York Times looks back at the Julian Assange story, after a U.N. report said Sweden and Britain should restore his freedom of movement and compensate him.
Six family members found dead in a Chicago home have been identified, the police said, and all suffered from "blunt trauma," although a full autopsy report was pending.

display_asset.caption: Megyn Kelly with Chris Wallace, left, and Bret Baier at a Republican presidential debate hosted by Fox News last month in Des Moines, Iowa.

summaries.body: Megyn Kelly, widely seen as a rising star as a Fox News anchor, has signed a book deal with HarperCollins, which expects a fall release.

display_asset.caption: The Rev. Nicholas Richards created a website, Roho, that makes available videos of the sermons of black ministers.

summaries.body: A website called Roho — “spirit” in Swahili — collects videos of the sermons of black ministers as well as data on who views them.

display_asset.caption: Continental, a big auto parts supplier, has a system it calls digital mirrors, eliminating cars’ Mickey Mouse ears.

summaries.body: Many automakers are demonstrating video systems that replace side mirrors with cameras, but it may take drivers some time to get used to them.

display_asset.caption: Downtown Flint, Mich., last month. Emails indicate that officials were concerned last March about a wave of Legionnaires’ cases and raised the possibility of a link to Flint River water.
display_asset.credit: Sarah Rice for The New York Times

summaries.body: Michigan state officials were aware last March of a wave of Legionnaires’ disease cases and a possible tie to Flint’s troubled water supply, newly released emails show.

display_asset.caption: Anthony Martignetti and Mrs. Fiumara in 2009, 40 years after their commercial was first broadcast.

summaries.body: Mary Fiumara, who played the mother who shouted “Anthony! Anthony!” from her apartment window in an indelible commercial for Prince spaghetti, has died at 88.
Your predilection for being a morning person could be linked to your DNA, genetics researchers have found.
A New Jersey man who accidentally flew a drone into the Empire State Building was arrested after he asked security guards there for help retrieving it, the police said.
McDonald’s has found a way to make a kale salad contain more calories than a Double Big Mac. Both unique offerings are available in Canada.

display_asset.caption: A rendering of the proposed streetcar line along a stretch in Brooklyn.
display_asset.credit: Friends of the Brooklyn Queens Connector

summaries.body: A planned streetcar line running from Brooklyn to Queens would provide a lifeline for a stretch of New York City that is starved of mass transit options, Jim Dwyer writes.
Since its premiere, "Birth of a Nation," by Nate Parker, has burned up search engines, eclipsing D. W. Griffith’s 1915 racist cinematic masterpiece of the same title.

display_asset.caption: Advanced weapons like the Patriot Advanced Capability-3 missile interceptor unit use semiconductors made with a little-known but increasingly important material called gallium nitride. China is said to want the technology to make gallium nitride chips.
display_asset.credit: The Yomiuri Shimbun, via Associated Press Images

summaries.body: China is spending billions on a major push to make its own microchips, an effort that could bolster its military capabilities as well as its homegrown technology industry.

display_asset.caption: Kevin Bacon in 2014. Mr. Bacon became the subject of a popular alternative to the six degrees of separation idea.

summaries.body: According to Facebook, "six degrees of separation" is a myth: People are more closely linked to each other — and Kevin Bacon — than commonly thought.
Two fireballs — an astronomical designation for meteors that appear brighter than Venus — were caught by various dashcams and rooftop cameras in recent days.
